pull.title: wallet: default wallet migration, modify inconvenient backup filename
pull.body:
Fixes #29584

On default legacy wallets, the backup filename starts with an "-" due to the wallet name being empty. This is inconvenient for systems who treat what follows the initial "-" character as flags.

Note:
As the user can freely set the wallet name to anything, we could also guard the backup filename against other inconvenient characters in the future (we need to be careful here, because the wallet name could also be a path).

issue.title: Proposed Timeline for Legacy Wallet and BDB removal
issue.body:
Here is a proposed timeline for the move from legacy wallets to descriptor wallets, and at the same time, bdb to sqlite, culminating with the removal of both legacy wallets and bdb. Even though the wallet type and the wallet storage format are orthogonal to each other, as noted in #19077, I would like to tie them together for the sake of simplicity when it comes to how we make new wallets and the migration of one type to another.

The 4 combinations of type and format are: legacy-bdb, legacy-sqlite, descriptor-bdb, and descriptor-sqlite. While all 4 types will be supported, we will primarily deal with legacy-bdb and descriptor-sqlite. Setting `descriptors=True` in `createwallet` (or checking the Descriptors option in the GUI) will always make a descriptor-sqlite. Setting that to `False` will always make a legacy-bdb.

- [x] 0.21 (late 2020)
  - [x] Initial release of descriptor type and sqlite format. (#16528, #19077)
  - [x] Descriptor type is experimental with a warning as such (#16528)
  - [x] Only legacy-bdb and descriptor-sqlite will be created (#19077)
- [x] 22.0 (mid 2021)
  - [x] Implement descriptor exports (#20226)
  - [x] Legacy type remains default (no pr needed)
  - [x] Introduce `dump` and `createfromdump` wallet tool commands with an additional `-format` option to specify the wallet type (#19137)
    * Users may use `dump` and then `createfromdump` in order to make legacy-sqlite from legacy-bdb
    * Users may use `dump` and then `createfromdump` in order to make descriptor-bdb from descriptor-sqlite
  - [x] If a wallet specified in conf or command line doesn't exist, don't make a wallet and instead warn (#15454)
- [x] 23.0 (early 2022)
  - [x] Change descriptor type to non-experimental (#23002)
  - [x] Change `createwallet` `descriptors` default to `True` (#23002)
  - [x] Change wallet tool `create` `-descriptors` default to `True` (#23002)
- [x] 24.0 (late 2022)
  - [x] Introduce `migratewallet` command to migrate a legacy-bdb to descriptor-sqlite (#19602)
  - [x] For newly created legacy-bdb wallets, warn that they are deprecated and will soon be unsupported (#24505)
- [x] 26.0 (late 2023)
  - [x] When loading legacy-bdb, descriptor-bdb, or legacy-sqlite wallets, warn that the legacy type and bdb format will soon be unsupported, as applicable. (#27869)
  - [x] Deprecate creating new legacy-bdb wallets #28597 
  - [x] `migratewallet` bug fixes
    - [x] #28609
    - [x] #28546
- [ ] 27.0 (early 2024)
  - [x] address book performance improvement #26836
  - [x] bulk deletion of txs performance improvement #28987
  - [x] bulk deletion of records performance improvement #29403
  - [x] Caching to improve performance of migrated non-HD descriptor wallets (also perf improvement in general) #26008
  - [x] Remove `migratewallet` experimental warning #28037 
- [ ] 28.0 (late 2024)
  - [ ] Improve performance of migratewallet #28574
  - [ ] Reimplement legacy-bdb to descriptor-sqlite migration (maybe as a separate command or in the wallet tool) to be independent of `LegacyScriptPubKeyMan` and BDB (#26596)
  - [ ] For `dump`, implement an independent BDB file loader (this should probably be shared with the previous) (#26606)
  - [ ] Stop creating new legacy-bdb wallets (not yet started)
  - [ ] GUI: Migrate wallets that are not loaded (not yet started)
  - [ ] Fix default wallet migration naming (#29586)
- [ ] 29.0 (early 2025)
  - [ ] Stop loading legacy-bdb, descriptor-bdb, legacy-sqlite wallet entirely. Inform users how to migrate (not yet started)
  - [ ] Remove `LegacyScriptPubKeyMan` except for the independent migration stuff (#28710)
  - [ ] Remove BDB except for independent loading for migration stuff (#28710)

Additional improvements that have no target deadline:

- [x] Backwards compatibility tests fixes for descriptor wallets #28027

The migration code will probably be around for a long time/forever.

Note that we expect users who go through the effort to make a legacy-sqlite or descriptor-bdb wallet to suck it up and deal with the consequences of doing something that isn't really supported. Such users should be able to figure out for themselves how to migrate their wallets. (Maybe `migratewallet` can migrate legacy-sqlite to descriptor-sqlite. bdb to sqlite is way easier than legacy to descriptor).

issue.title: migratewallet: backup file has inconvenient name
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

The `migratewallet` RPC can create a backup named (something like) `-998239328.legacy.bak`. Files starting with a `-` are somewhat inconvenient to work with in UNIX, because commands confuse them with a flag, especally when using `*`. It's usually possible to work around this with `--` but still, it would be more convenient to use positive numbers only.

### Expected behaviour

It would be more convenient to use positive numbers only.

### Steps to reproduce

`bitcoin-cli migratewallet ""`

### Relevant log output

N/A

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Compiled from source

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

v26.0

### Operating system and version

Debian Linux

### Machine specifications

_No response_

issue.title: Remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency
issue.body:
The final step of #20160.

A bare minimum of legacy wallet code is kept in order to perform wallet migration. Migration of legacy wallets uses the independent BDB parser and a minimal `LegacyDataSPKM` that allows the legacy data to be loaded so that the migration can be completed.

All tests which tested legacy wallet behavior have been removed. The `--descriptors` and `--legacy-wallet` options are removed from the functional tests.

BDB has been removed as a dependency and documentation have been updated to reflect that.

Depends on #26596

wallet: default wallet migration, modify inconvenient backup filename

On default legacy wallets, the backup filename starts with an "-" due
to the wallet name being empty. This is inconvenient for systems who
treat what follows the initial "-" character as flags.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -529,11 +529,20 @@ def test_default_wallet(self):
         self.log.info("Test migration of the wallet named as the empty string")
         wallet = self.create_legacy_wallet("")
 
-        self.migrate_wallet(wallet)
+        # Move time to have a unique name
+        curr_time = int(time.time()) + 100
+        wallet.setmocktime(curr_time)
+
+        res = self.migrate_wallet(wallet)
comments.body: Good idea on putting the time into the name, but why do you add 100 instead of just using the current time?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -529,11 +529,20 @@ def test_default_wallet(self):
         self.log.info("Test migration of the wallet named as the empty string")
         wallet = self.create_legacy_wallet("")
 
-        self.migrate_wallet(wallet)
+        # Move time to have a unique name
+        curr_time = int(time.time()) + 100
+        wallet.setmocktime(curr_time)
+
+        res = self.migrate_wallet(wallet)
comments.body:
> why do you add 100 instead of just using the current time?

Just because I coded it while we were on the weekly meeting.. and took `time.time()` as the node's mocked time. Fixed. Thanks.
